text: Hohi Ngapera Te Moana Keri Kaa (1942 - 26 August 2020) was a New Zealand writer, educator and activist for te reo M훮ori. During her time in Wellington, Kaa was involved with the Haeata Women's Collective (a group of M훮ori women artists), the Herstory diary project, and the Waiata Koa collective. Her children's book Taka Ki Ro Wai, written in the Waiapu dialect of te reo, won the inaugural M훮ori language category in the New Zealand Post Book Awards for Children and Young Adults and honored in the National Design Awards for creative director Martin Page's work. Kaa died on 26 August 2020, aged 78.Keri Kaa shared gifts of her tipuna ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2020 deaths Category:New Zealand writers Category:M훮ori rights activists Category:New Zealand educators
title: Keri Kaa
